page.title: 10LAW AND ORDER:East Sheffield
page.content: {Crime}in the area is on the increase at the rate of 10 to 12% a year, the main crimes being thefts and burglaries of houses, shops and warehouses. Serious crimes such as murder happen only infrequently, probably about once every two years. The{police}in the area have duties which include patroling the streets to help to prevent and detect crime, traffic ofences, attending to domestic disputes and sexual assaults and looking for missing persons. Crime detection rate in 1984 was approximately 40%, but was hindered by the fact that many police officers were engaged in duties connected with the miners strike. The neighbourhood policeman, or {community constable,}walks around the area and talks to people to find out problems and helps to sort them out.
